medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant (RUQ) and epigastric pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain has been constant since 6:30 AM this morning. The patient has had 3 similar episodes in the past two and a half weeks, which were less severe and self-resolved. The patient describes the pain as severe, achy, and heavy, with mild improvement after morphine. The pain does not radiate, is not positional, and is not associated with food intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV controlled on medication, HCV with viral load <43, hyperlipidemia, history of alcohol abuse (in remission), HPV with perianal condyloma acuminatum, history of syphilis, migraines, history of fractured coccyx, recent back abscess treated with serial I&D and antibiotics, and depression.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has osteoporosis, father has hypertension, and 5 siblings are alive and well.
medical_history.social_history: History of alcohol abuse, but has not consumed alcohol in several years. Tobacco use disorder.
